Line 110: Line 110:
===Uprising===
===Uprising===
{{main|Battle of Sana'a}}
{{main|Battle of Sana'a}}
  +
[[File:Yemeni Protests 4-Apr-2011 P01.JPG|thumb|Protesters in [[Sanaâa]].]]
  +
On 23 May, a day after Saleh refused to sign the transition agreement, Sheikh [[Sadiq al-Ahmar]], the head of the [[Hashid]] tribal federation, one of the most powerful tribes in the country, declared support for the opposition and his armed supporters came into conflict with loyalist security forces in the capital Sana'a after Saleh ordered al-Ahmar's arrest.<ref name="570news"/> Heavy street fighting ensued, which included artillery and mortar shelling.<ref name="570news"/><ref name="cnn.com"/><ref name="thenational.ae"/><ref name="alternet.org"/><ref name="usatoday.com"/> The militiamen had surrounded and blocked off several government buildings in the capital<ref>[http://www.voanews.com/english/news/middle-east/in-transition/Renewed-Yemen-Clashes-Leave-at-Least-Seven-Dead-122497914.html Yemeni Tribesmen Take Control of Government Buildings in Sana'a]</ref> and people on the ground were reporting that it looked like the situation was deteriorating into a civil war.<ref>[http://www.watoday.com.au/world/yemen-on-the-brink-of-civil-war-20110524-1f1l1.html Yemen on the brink of civil war]</ref>
On 23 May, a day after Saleh refused to sign the transition agreement, Sheikh [[Sadiq al-Ahmar]], the head of the [[Hashid]] tribal federation, one of the most powerful tribes in the country, declared support for the opposition and his armed supporters came into conflict with loyalist security forces in the capital Sana'a after Saleh ordered al-Ahmar's arrest.<ref name="570news"/> Heavy street fighting ensued, which included artillery and mortar shelling.<ref name="570news"/><ref name="cnn.com"/><ref name="thenational.ae"/><ref name="alternet.org"/><ref name="usatoday.com"/> The militiamen had surrounded and blocked off several government buildings in the capital<ref>[http://www.voanews.com/english/news/middle-east/in-transition/Renewed-Yemen-Clashes-Leave-at-Least-Seven-Dead-122497914.html Yemeni Tribesmen Take Control of Government Buildings in Sana'a]</ref> and people on the ground were reporting that it looked like the situation was deteriorating into a civil war.<ref>[http://www.watoday.com.au/world/yemen-on-the-brink-of-civil-war-20110524-1f1l1.html Yemen on the brink of civil war]</ref>
Line 131: Line 133:
On 6 August, Saleh left the hospital in Saudi Arabia, but he did not return to Yemen. <ref>Al Jazeera Yemen Live Blog. [http://blogs.aljazeera.net/liveblog/yemen-aug-7-2011-0935|Sunday, August 7, 2011 - 09:35 Entry]</ref>
On 6 August, Saleh left the hospital in Saudi Arabia, but he did not return to Yemen. <ref>Al Jazeera Yemen Live Blog. [http://blogs.aljazeera.net/liveblog/yemen-aug-7-2011-0935|Sunday, August 7, 2011 - 09:35 Entry]</ref>
  +
==Domestic responses==
==Domestic responses==
On 27 January, Yemeni Interior Minister [[Mutaher al-Masri]] said that "Yemen is not like Tunisia."<ref name="Yemen isnt Tunisia">{{cite news
